metadata.Name: BoolQ
metadata.Description: BoolQ is a reading comprehension dataset of naturally occurring yes/no questions, requiring a wide range of inference abilities to solve.
metadata.Paper Title: BoolQ: Exploring the Surprising Difficulty of Natural Yes/No Questions
metadata.Venue Title: BoolQ: Exploring the Surprising Difficulty of Natural Yes/No Questions
Affiliations: Paul G. Allen School of CSE, University of Washington
metadata.Abstract: In this paper we study yes/no questions that are naturally occurring --- meaning they are generated in unprompted and unconstrained settings. We build a reading comprehension dataset, BoolQ, of such questions, and show that they are unexpectedly challenging. They often query for complex, non-factoid information, and require difficult entailment-like inference to solve.
